Topic.Title: Gas prices choking America. What happen Democraps? Where's the outcry that gas is $3.89 here in California

Message.Msg: Post-Katrina, due mostly to speculation, oil soared to $145 per barrel. Along with domestic refinery and distribution problems, this caused gas prices to hit around $3.50 per gallon in New England. Today,with world markets awash in oil, crude is 'only' $93 per barrel, but gas is $3.60 per gallon. The source of the problem must be somewhere between the oil tanks and the gas tanks, right? Can you figure out where that might be? BTW, domestic crude production, which fell during every year that Bush was in office, has risen every year since Obama took over. Meanwhile, on Obama's watch, the US has begun EXPORTING refined petroleum products at record levels; last year it was the #1 US export! Still having trouble locating the source of the problem? It's the oil companies, genius! Would you like Obama to step in and bust them up? Nationalize them? Penalize them? Dump some oil out of the Strategic Petroleum Reserve and onto the spot market? Prevent them from exporting refined petroleum until domestic gas price fall to some specific level?Quit trying to blame Democrats (your spelling needs a little more attention than you've been giving it) and focus your anger where it belongs: on the Republican-controlled oil giants and their monopoly. All that highly-touted Keystone pipeline will do is bring more crude oil to the Gulf oil refineries that can't process what they already have in abundance, and increase the already obscene margins they're operating with. Do you think Mitt is going to play hardball with them? ROTFLMAO at GOP detectives who make Inspector Clouseau look like Sherlock Holmes everywhere.

Message.Msg: I haven't owned a Caddy since they turned to junk around 1981; nothing but Lincoln Town Cars for me (3 of them). On the angling side, the only fish The Fish catches and eats are trout, salmon, Atlantic shad (the anadromous ones) and an occasional striped bass or bluefish. Thanks to my surprisingly lucrative career in high-tech, a few paying gigs as a (wait for it, it's bound to shock you) writer, and a wife with a full-time job, you won't find me in the welfare OR unemployment lines. What I actually hope for is TWO viable candidates instead of ZERO, so like everyone else I'm just making the best of a bad situation. Topic.Title: Will Romney use the Bible or the Book of

Message.Msg: The eighth LDS Article of Faith states: "We believe the Bible to be the word of God as far as it is translated correctly." The Mormons believe the Bible has gone through repeated editing that has changed the meaning of the text. Thus they are skeptical of any translation of the Bible. However, they view the King James Version as the least corrupt of the versions available today. They print their own Bible (King James Version) with additional LDS footnotes, dictionary and topical guide. These cross reference to their other books of scripture and provide LDS explanations.

Message.Title: Volume is SO low
Message.Msg: This volume is what will cause the squeeze. Shorts cannot cover now, even if they want to. Some of the option buying you are seeing is hedging, but they can't buy enough options to hedge their positions. The only questions is this: will the squeeze bring in the momentum players or will the momentum players bring on the squeeze. The move to $10 is going to move faster, when it hits, than it did a few months ago. It might take only a day or two.

Topic.Title: Will Obama Cause a Civil War??

Message.Msg: or you don't know a tax when you see one. If you don't think the hidden burden of carrying that giga-rich ruling class is a tax, the citizens of France can give you a few trenchant history lessons to the contrary that might better illuminate your dim view [and grasp] of the issue. The difference is that even the illiterate rabble who carried out the French Revolution were able to recognize the royals and their cohorts as an unjust tax. It amazes me that so many others seem unable or unwilling to do the same. This country has become so enamored of the chiseler, the con man, and the card sharp, they've attained the status of kings and queens of the realm. They hold all the aces; nothing below a jack plays, and the best the rest of us jokers can hope for is to be included now and then in one of their Charity Night penny-ante games. All that remains is for the next round of fiat currency to bear a steamboat on one side, and the grinning visage of good-looking Bret Maverick on the other. ROTFLMAO at people whining about the wrong taxes everywhere.
